title: Navy Yard Tall Shio Boston Building Permit for 1 East Pier Drive Boston

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Navy Yard Tall Shio Boston Building Permit for 1 East Pier Drive Boston
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Hi,
I would like to get information on a Boston restaurant named the Tall Ship Boston (the Caledonia) which was opened on 1 East Pier Drive, in Boston, MA. 
I believe that Pier is owned by the Massachusetts Port Authority, but it may also be under the jurisdiction of the US Coast Guard, as well since the restaurant is afloat in Boston Harbor, and because it has a gangway. 
The developer/owner of the Restaurant is Charles Lamer, and his name is on some of the City Permits. His company is called Navy Yard Hospitality, I believe. 
I am interested in knowing if Massport has had any jurisdiction over the development of that site, including the gangway to the ship. 
The City of Boston’s Inspectional Services said it was not under their jurisdiction, and suggested I contact your office. 
I also know that the Project was done under the regulations for Massachusetts (Chapter 91). I am interested in any architectural drawings, Permit applications and Permits related to the gangway leading from the Pier up to the ship.
Please let me know if this is in your jurisdiction, and how I can get access to the building permit documents for that restaurant.
Thank You,
Victor A. Popp, PE 
 
VPOPP Inc.
75 Gardner St.; Hingham, MA 02043
781-875-1085 Office
781-264-7769 Cell Phone

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victor Popp, PE

title: Cal Poly Humboldt Basketball Expense Reports

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Cal Poly Humboldt Basketball Expense Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and All financial records related to the operating costs associated with the California Polytechnic State University Humboldt (formerly California State University Humboldt) men's intercollegiate basketball team during the 2022-2023 school year.

Specifically, records of all expense reports related to the costs of travel on road trips including hotel accommodations, travel costs, and food costs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Matson

title: VANCOUVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT – (2019) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2019 – and 6,681 recently located electronic pages.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: VANCOUVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT – (2019) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2019 – and 6,681 recently locate
communications.communication:
VANCOUVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS DISTRICT – (2019) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2019 – and 6,681 recently located electronic pages.

Via email: publicrecordsrequest@vansd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.

2.	Upon information and belief your agency has recently scanned into electronic format 5,377 pages of documents responsive to this request.

3.	Upon information and belief your agency possesses another 1304 electronic pages of documents responsive to this request for a total of 6,681 electronic pages responsive to this request , please provide these electronic  records.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.
Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.
RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."
This public records request is being made via email to your agency’s publicly posted public records request email address: publicrecordsrequest@vansd.org. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Wyoming DOC Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Wyoming Public Records Act Request: Wyoming DOC Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mercy Loyo

title: Dish Wireless Jurisdiction Records (New Bedford City Clerk)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, filings, spreadsheets, emails, communications, or any other form of medium with references to “Dish Wireless” (a US carrier founded in 2020), their owned and operated cell sites, and their operations in your jurisdiction in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

title: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Seat Pleasant Police Department)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Seat Pleasant Police Department)
RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Seat Pleasant Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The City of Seat Pleasant has received the Maryland Public Information Act Request for the Seat Pleasant Police Department sworn officers, and civilian members. The request will be processed no later than,  Tuesday, April 11, 2023.

If you have any questions or need additional information regarding the above matter, please feel free to contact me directly by e-mail at dlanham@seatpleasantmd.gov<mailto:dlanham@seatpleasantmd.gov>.


Kindest Regards,

Dashaun N. Lanham, CMC
City Clerk
City of Seat Pleasant
“A Smart City of Excellence”
6301 Addison Rd.
Seat Pleasant, MD 20743
301-336-2600 Office
240-532-6385 Direct
240-455-2605 Cellular
301-636-4381 Facsimile
www.seatpleasantmd.gov


President, Maryland Municipal Clerks Association
[cid:image001.jpg@01D96174.7AEEEF00]
This E-mail and any of its attachments may contain proprietary information, protected health information or other confidential information, which is privileged and confidential. This E-mail is intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient of this E-mail, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution copying or action taken, in relation to the contents of and attachments to this E-mail is strictly prohibited by federal law and/or State law and may expose you to civil and/or criminal penalties. If you have received this E-mail in error, please notify the send immediately and permanently delete the original and any copy of this E-mail and any printout of this E-mail and attachments. Furthermore, while the information contained in this E-mail is believed to be correct and reliable, the City does not make such warranty and reserves the right to modify or correct the information contained in this E-mail as necessary or appropriate.

New York cannabis license applications

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York cannabis license applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic spreadsheet of all licenses filed with your agency for cannabis related activities.

I ask that all data fields be made available in the release, including the application date, the applicant name, the disposition of their application, the applicant's gender and race, as well as their social and economic equity status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: CUSTOMER - New Customer Welcome Message
communications.communication:
Dear Ben Welsh, 
 
Thank you for registering with the NYS Office of Cannabis Management FOIL Records Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log into the FOIL Records Center to update any contact or password information.  You will so be able to monitor and track the progress the of your request and receive most responsive documents. 
 Your Login ID is:  143535-35944258@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSqyEZVT21hnud-2B6GvJwQ8QhlCX2S9bNsoBuaHnn1mVoyX7ajKQ0FV-2FtZr-2FDzEyLsfK8DikxN1mFtdoDxtCaLf0-3DAipV_wk0A0XaKfI9-2FP4RHAVcoyE2mxCvoRiKWzAeEXQeJxaUcjV67mJGRNCZ8mc-2FiUGsf3MIwpp28AmPcRvi6aioW9L3A5HJv5YrBmvUjKcQzhwEgeFi0oCkbDkUTp8X7xuZktRqlVp32-2FlsUX-2B5XUnsu5vps1R3osIdM3fFL7uYuvtUsI2Jfm1nWCzJoWx-2BNa2pT-2F6tgJEoj2pqgDaSL1R5FuEmNrxD-2BUvTBI-2B7DWfX6FJ0-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Records Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: FOIL Records Request :: R000192-032823
communications.communication:
Dear Ben Welsh: 
This message acknowledges receipt of your request. Your request was received in this office on 3/28/2023 and given the reference number R000192-032823 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic spreadsheet of all licenses filed with your agency for cannabis related activities.

I ask that all data fields be made available in the release, including the application date, the applicant name, the disposition of their application, the applicant's gender and race, as well as their social and economic equity status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Use of Force Policy

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any and all files pertaining to the policies, practices, procedures, rules or orders concerning the use of force
-And and all files that contain a verifiable record of training to be able to properly implement the use of force as outlined in any  policies, practices, procedures, rules or orders between the dates of January 1st, 2020 and December 31st, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sterling Andrew Moore

title: Files Regarding Arrest and Detainment of James Daniel Moore (Dallas Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any and all files regarding the arrest or detainment of James Daniel Moore
-Subject at the time was aged between 45-60
-Caucasian
-Blue Eyes
-Arrests or detainments occurring between the years 2001 to 2009
-Has a registered address of either 804, Glendale Drive, Keller, Texas or 1351, Cross Timber Drive
-Was imprisoned within the state of Texas for a minimum of 5 years

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Sterling Andrew Moore

title: Arlington County Public Schools Book/Material Availabilities (Arlington County Public Schools)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any records generated or received pursuant to any policy concerning challenges to curricular, instructional, or library materials.

2. A copy of any complaints (including informal complaints), and any records generated as a result of the complaints, where the complaint led to a change in status of any book or material in a school library.

3. A copy of any current policy concerning challenges to curricular, instructional, or library materials.

4. A copy of any public records requests received concerning books, library materials, or curricular materials and any records produced in response to the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Sterling Andrew Moore.

title: Statistics Involving Rejected Applicants due to violation of Marijuana Use Guidelines

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Statistics Involving Rejected Applicants due to violation of Marijuana Use Guidelines
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any and all files regarding the number of applicants for employment under the FBI spanning from January 1st, 2020 to December 31st, 2020, who were rejected upon the criteria of having used marijuana or any of its various forms (e.g., cannabis, hashish (hash), hash oil, or tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), synthetic or natural), in any location (domestic or foreign) regardless of the legality in that location of use.
-Any and all files regarding the number of applicants for employment under the FBI spanning from January 1st, 2021 to December 31st, 2021, who were rejected upon the criteria of having used marijuana or any of its various forms (e.g., cannabis, hashish (hash), hash oil, or tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), synthetic or natural), in any location (domestic or foreign) regardless of the legality in that location of use, more than 24 times after turning 18 years old.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sterling Andrew Moore

title: Dish Wireless

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Dish Wireless
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, filings, spreadsheets, emails, communications, or any other form of medium with references to “Dish Wireless” (a US carrier founded in 2020), their owned and operated cell sites, and their operations in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents describing the 2007 investigation “Operation Flagrant Foul”, regarding NBA referee Tim Donaghy and fellow constituents involved.

title: T-Mobile Contracts

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: T-Mobile Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) The contract between the Department and T-Mobile, USA allowing T-Mobile to build and maintain a 4G LTE network at the Naval Base in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

(2) Documentation outlining the construction and maintenance of the T-Mobile 4G LTE network at Guantanamo Bay.

(3) Any communications between the Department and T-Mobile, USA resulting from technical issues with any Services or Devices provided by T-Mobile, USA.

(4) Information in relation to bids from AT&T, Verizon, or T-Mobile, USA, for digital networks or Devices to be used on Navy properties.

If any of this information is deemed to fall under the nine Exemptions outlined by the Freedom of Information Act, please redact it using white boxes if possible, rather than withholding or cutting the information out.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

Florida Department of Corrections

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of any contracts, MOUs or other written agreements between the district and/or any district schools and Care Net Pregnancy Center of Borger.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Butrymowicz

title: FDOC employees fired 2022

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FDOC employees fired 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- any list of employees who were arrested during 2022.
- any list of employees terminated during 2022and reason for dismissal .

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella
